Title: Ginger crunch
Author: Felicity
Intro:
Let's talk ginger crunch for a while shall we?
A classic Kiwi slice, baked by everyone's nan at some stage, ginger crunch has got to be a favourite in most households. Here's my version.
Body:
My rocking Nana Joan is still baking ginger crunch on a regular basis for the family visitors every weekend, even though she is a young 95 and has every right to pass the ginger crunch making buck onto someone else.

Crunchy buttery biscuit base, topped with an equal layer of one hell of a ginger punch icing, the following recipe quickly became a farmers market favourite for The Sweet Eatery, a previous business of mine. In fact, we had one lady who at first put her nose up to it for being GF, however upon trying it she became quite a regular purchasing at least 4 slices every week. Yep that's right people, don't knock it before you try it!

Well Nana Joan, let's continue spreading the love for this kiwi classic shall we?
Method: Preheat oven to 180˚C and line a slice tin (20 x 30cm) with baking paper. Set aside
Combine the flour, caster sugar, and 2tsp ginger in a bowl, then rub the first measure of butter in with your hands until it resembles breadcrumbs.
Press into tin and bake for 15 minutes or until lightly golden. Set aside to cool while you make the topping.
Melt the second measure of butter, syrup and 3 Tbsp of ginger together in a medium saucepan.
Once melted, take it off the heat and stir through the icing sugar, then pour over the cooled base.
Place in the fridge to set completely.
To cut, heat a large knife under hot water, wipe clean on a tea towel and slice. Clean your knife between each cut to get nice, sharp pieces.

Comments.Comment: Such a classic recipe. It was yum
